page.title: 01Lower Glen Fruin
page.content: Predominatly farmland the area is sparsely populated and utiliZed for stock both dairy & single suckler cows & sheep. Nearly all the land is owned by Luss estates but most of the land let. Being so close to Helensborgh it is also much used for Recreation - Mostly informal. Glen Fruin running & Joging races vie with walkers and picnickers along the roads and close to the river. Highlandman's wood (replanted 1985) is also used by RHU & Dhuhillr residents to exercise dogs. All the land is wet & boggy and needs constant maintenance to keep good grassland. There are obviously (to the eye) good & poor farmers as with the state of walls and fences.
